title: perma ban time frame?
body:
Understanding I was toxic etc to get banned.
Wondering if a time frame can reform a player from perm ban?
In other games perma ban can be 18-24+ months.
Wondering if this is the case for LOL

replies.body:
oh ok, thanks for your time.
I thought 'permanent' was clear until I had accounts in other games come out of a perm ban

Reform rates at permanent suspension tier are incredibly low and Riot have a lot of data over a very long period of time to support that. They did still try a reform tactic, basically good behaviour for a long enough period on a new account would earn you back your old one, but it had an almost 100% relapse rate. 

Those who earned their accounts back just went right back to their old behaviour because the threat and consequence of perma bans was made basically nonexistent. Needless to say they scrapped that pretty quickly.

That said, you aren't banned, your account is. There's nothing stopping you from creating a new account and continuing to enjoy the game, though naturally if the behaviour that resulted in a perma ban in the first place continues you will face those same punishments on any new accounts.

It used to be 3 months. If you behaved and weren't reported for 3 months, your account would "heal" a little.
It no longer says that in the FAQ, it simply says be good for a period of time and your account will heal.

HOWEVER, if you break a severe enough rule, you can get perma banned immediately without another warning.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286-Instant-Feedback-System-FAQ-

I believe he's saying he's already been perma banned and is asking if there's any way to restore his account, to which the short answer is no and the slightly longer answer is they tried that and it didn't work so no.
my bad. thought the word "Permanent" was pretty understandable.

until tyler 1 himself was perma banned and all of his accounts were until his could make them some money and advertise them. apparently permanent has different meanings after money is involved (lets not make it to obvious)

Tyler1 never had any permanently banned accounts returned. It was the player ban they lifted (which as I understand wasn't permanent so much as until further notice) because they re-evaluated that policy.
